intro: Ligusticum panul, commonly known as the Japanese lovage, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its rhizomes and roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Ligusticum panul thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
